page.title: 12CHURCH
page.content: The village church. The village church of Sturton is called the church ofSt Peter and St Paul and it is afine building.It's origins go back to the year 1180 when the church is suppsed to have been founded by Lady Olivia.Ov er the following centuries additions were made and by 1900 the church could boast apeal of 5 bells placed in an oak frame in the tower, a fine organ and a clock.However in 1901 it was completely gutted by fire and had to be rebuilt. the churches excellent present day condition is due to this rebuilding.Bowman and sons of Stamford did the work.The church was re-opened on December 3rd 1902.The rector lives in North Wheatley and is responsible for that parish,Sturton,Bole and Littleboruugh.There is an excellent choir called "The Messengers".
